intro: Hieracium acrophylloides, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hieracium acrophylloides is often found in high-altitude environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
